trans-unit.source: Get started with authentication (Xamarin.Android) - Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Get started with authentication (Xamarin.Android) - Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use authentication in your Azure Mobile Services app for Xamarin.Android.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use authentication in your Azure Mobile Services app for Xamarin.Android.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Mobile Services app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your Xamarin.Android app. In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services. After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users in Azure Mobile Services from your Xamarin.Android app. In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Mobile Services. After being successfully authenticated and authorized by Mobile Services, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable authentication in your app:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial walks you through these basic steps to enable authentication in your app:

trans-unit.source: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]
trans-unit.target: [Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services]

trans-unit.source: [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]
trans-unit.target: [Restrict table permissions to authenticated users]

trans-unit.source: [Add authentication to the app]
trans-unit.target: [Add authentication to the app]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial requires Xamarin.Android and Android SDK 4.2 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial requires Xamarin.Android and Android SDK 4.2 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Register your app for authentication and configure Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: In Eclipse, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: In Eclipse, open the project that you created when you completed the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: From the Run menu, then click Run to start the app; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: From the Run menu, then click Run to start the app; verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the TodoItem table now requires authentication.
trans-unit.target: This happens because the app attempts to access Mobile Services as an unauthenticated user, but the TodoItem table now requires authentication.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the app to authenticate users before requesting resources from the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: Add the following property to the ToDoActivity class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following property to the ToDoActivity class:

trans-unit.source: Add the following method to the ToDoActivity class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following method to the ToDoActivity class:

trans-unit.source: This creates a new method to handle the authentication process.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new method to handle the authentication process.

trans-unit.source: The user is authenticated by using a Microsoft Account login.
trans-unit.target: The user is authenticated by using a Microsoft Account login.

trans-unit.source: A dialog is displayed which displays the ID of the authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: A dialog is displayed which displays the ID of the authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: You cannot proceed without a positive authentication.
trans-unit.target: You cannot proceed without a positive authentication.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an identity provider other than Microsoft, change the value passed to the login method above to one of the following: Facebook, Google, Twitter, or WindowsAzureActiveDirectory.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an identity provider other than Microsoft, change the value passed to the login method above to one of the following: Facebook, Google, Twitter, or WindowsAzureActiveDirectory.

trans-unit.source: In the OnCreate method, add the following line of code after the code that instantiates the MobileServiceClient object.
trans-unit.target: In the OnCreate method, add the following line of code after the code that instantiates the MobileServiceClient object.

trans-unit.source: This call starts the authentication process and awaits it asynchronously.
trans-unit.target: This call starts the authentication process and awaits it asynchronously.

trans-unit.source: Move the remaining code after await Authenticate(); in the OnCreate method to a new CreateTable method, which looks like this:
trans-unit.target: Move the remaining code after await Authenticate(); in the OnCreate method to a new CreateTable method, which looks like this:

trans-unit.source: Then call the new CreateTable method in OnCreate after the Authenticate call added in step 2:
trans-unit.target: Then call the new CreateTable method in OnCreate after the Authenticate call added in step 2:

trans-unit.source: From the Run menu, then click Run to start the app and sign in with your chosen identity provider.
trans-unit.target: From the Run menu, then click Run to start the app and sign in with your chosen identity provider.

trans-unit.source: When you are successfully logged-in, the app should run without errors, and you should be able to query Mobile Services and make updates to data.
trans-unit.target: When you are successfully logged-in, the app should run without errors, and you should be able to query Mobile Services and make updates to data.

trans-unit.source: Get completed example
trans-unit.target: Get completed example

trans-unit.source: Download the [completed example project].
trans-unit.target: Download the [completed example project].

trans-unit.source: Be sure to update the applicationURL and applicationKey variables with your own Azure settings.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to update the applicationURL and applicationKey variables with your own Azure settings.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Next steps
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Next steps

trans-unit.source: In the next tutorial, [Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: In the next tutorial, [Authorize users with scripts], you will take the user ID value provided by Mobile Services based on an authenticated user and use it to filter the data returned by Mobile Services.
